SEARCH
Package Game

Class GameEnvironment

java.lang.Object
Game.GameEnvironment
Direct Known Subclasses:
Challenge, Room, Shopkeeper
public abstract class GameEnvironment extends Object
Represents an abstract game environment that provides playable scenarios. Subclasses must define specific types of Environments.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameEnvironment

      public GameEnvironment(int id, String initialMessage, GameEnvironment nextEnvironment)
      Constructs a GameEnvironment that that transitions to another one. Sets nextNode value to -1. This information is used by the Environment's rum method.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the environment
      initialMessage - The message to be displayed in the beginning of the environment situation
      nextEnvironment - The next environment to be called

    • GameEnvironment

      public GameEnvironment(int id, String initialMessage, int nextNode)
      Constructs the final GameEnvironment in a sequence. Sets nextEnvironment value to null. This information is used by the Environment's rum method.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the environment
      initialMessage - The message to be displayed in the beginning of the environment situation
      nextNode - The id of the Node to be called in sequence. It must be 0 if it is the final game Environment.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public abstract int run(Hero hero)
      Executes the GameEnvironment behavior. It must be implemented by subclasses to define the specific scenario.
      Parameters:
      hero - The hero character interacting with the environment.
      Returns:
      An integer representing a game status: -1 if the Hero loses the game in current environment 0 if the Environment is the last obstacle in the game or the nextNode id if Hero passes successfully by the environment
